ticket.title: Rails 3 does not create lib directory when using Ruby 1.9.1
ticket.original-body:
There seems to be a bug in the installer script for Rails 3 when using Ruby 1.9.1.
I don't know if this is specific to the installer in the Ubuntu APT repository or not, but I was able to find a thread on ruby-forum.com with the exact same issue, but running a different version of Ubuntu.
http://www.ruby-forum.com/topic/208560
ERROR: While executing gem ... (Errno::ENOENT) No such file or directory - lib
This is definitely a bug. I am not sure if it's specific to Ubuntu or not.

version.body:
I trying to reproduce this bug on Mac OS, but rails --pre successfully installed:
Mac OS X 10.6.3, ruby 1.9.1p378 (2010-01-10 revision 26273) [i386-darwin10.3.0], Rubygems 1.3.6
version.body-html:
I trying to reproduce this bug on Mac OS, but rails --pre successfully installed:

Mac OS X 10.6.3, ruby 1.9.1p378 (2010-01-10 revision 26273) [i386-darwin10.3.0], Rubygems 1.3.6
version.title: Rails 3 does not create lib directory when using Ruby 1.9.1

version.body: works fine with ubuntu 9.10, ruby 1.9.1p378 with rvm
version.body-html: works fine with ubuntu 9.10, ruby 1.9.1p378 with rvm
version.title: Rails 3 does not create lib directory when using Ruby 1.9.1

version.body:
Presently, I am not using RVM. I am not sure how relevant that is or not.
I am also using the 64 bit architecture of Ubuntu 10.4.
I believe Ruby is still running in 32 bit, but I am not positive on that.
If it does in fact run in native 64 bit, then perhaps this issue could be with the 64 bit optimized releases..
version.body-html:
Presently, I am not using RVM. I am not sure how relevant that is or not.

I am also using the 64 bit architecture of Ubuntu 10.4.

I believe Ruby is still running in 32 bit, but I am not positive on that.

If it does in fact run in native 64 bit, then perhaps this issue could be with the 64 bit optimized releases..

version.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.
The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.
Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.
version.body-html:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.

The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.

Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.
